title: Jota injury the only negative from Liverpool win at Inter - Klopp
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says the only negative from his team's 2-0 win over Inter Milan in the Champions League is an ankle injury to Diogo Jota.

title: Ukraine: Invasion fears are hype and hysteria - Russian diplomat
description: Russia's deputy ambassador to the UN says Russia will not initiate a war if it is not provoked.

title: McIlroy warns young players over 'not so Super League'
description: Former world number one Rory McIlroy warns younger players they would be taking a massive risk by joining what he calls a "not so Super League".

title: Prince Andrew's statement seems to contradict answers he gave me - Emily Maitlis
description: The BBC Newsnight presenter compares Prince Andrew's latest statement with the defence he offered in their 2019 interview.

title: Batman scene funeral for Only Fools and Horses fan in Essex
description: An Only Fools and Horses-themed funeral with its famous Batman scene is held for a fan of the show.

title: Prince Andrew: Where does he get his money from?
description: Questions remain over how Prince Andrew will be able to afford his legal settlement.

title: Alina Pash: Singer won't represent Ukraine at Eurovision
description: With ongoing tensions between Russia and Ukraine, Alina Pash hoped to represent her country in May.

title: Bayeux Tapestry: Wisbech teacher fretting over famous embroidery errors
description: A woman says copying mistakes in the tapestry is "doing my head in" as she recreates a full replica.

title: Care leavers to get £1,600 a month in Wales scheme
description: The Welsh government's three-year basic income experiment will be aimed at 18-year-olds.

title: Scotland to offer Covid jab to children aged 5-11
description: The Scottish government says it has received "draft" advice on vaccinating children from the JCVI.

title: Police to investigate Prince Charles' charity
description: Police to investigate claims that Prince Charles' charity offered honours help to Saudi citizen

title: Storm Dudley: Met Office amber wind warning updated
description: The Met Office is warning gusts of 80mph could hit some parts of Scotland, England and Northern Ireland.

title: Watch: The moment a sloth was saved from electrical wires
description: A sloth in Colombia found itself in an unusual and dangerous place, prompting a rescue mission.

title: Boohoo ad banned for objectifying and sexualising women
description: The Advertising Standards Authority said the retailer's advert was irresponsible and likely to cause offence.

title: Living costs hit fresh 30-year high as households squeezed
description: Inflation rose by 5.5% in the 12 months to January, hitting a fresh 30-year high.

title: Building world football's most exciting young XI: week one, striker
description: A new BBC Sounds podcast is building football's most exciting young XI and it kicks off with a striker destined for the Premier League.

title: Valieva sample 'showed traces of three drugs'
description: Kamila Valieva's anti-doping sample showed traces of three drugs that can be used to treat heart conditions, according to a New York Times report.

title: Prince Andrew: Questions over payout after settlement with Virginia Giuffre
description: No details of the Duke of York's payout to Virginia Giuffre have been made public.

title: Trainer suspended over treatment of horse in video
description: Trainer Sir Mark Todd is given an interim suspension by the British Horseracing Authority after a video on social media appeared to show him hit a horse with a branch.

title: Winter Olympics: Bruce Mouat helps Team GB men beat ROC to win eighth round-robin match
description: GB skipper Bruce Mouat helps Team GB men beat ROC to win the eighth round-robin match of their group in the Curling.

title: GB women's curlers lose to China - highlights & report
description: Great Britain's women's curlers' hopes of reaching the semi-finals of the Winter Olympics are in danger after slipping to a shock 8-4 loss to China.

title: Covid: Wrexham cousins forge blacksmiths business in lockdown
description: Ollie and Harvey's metal designs have been bought from as far away as Indonesia.

title: New Zealand: Scientists discover rare baby ghost shark
description: The creature is rarely spotted as it prefers to live in the murky depths of the sea floor.

title: Winter Olympics: Slovakia progress to semi-finals after shock win against USA
description: Slovakia's men's hockey team will compete in the semi-finals after a dramatic penalty shootout victory against the USA at the Winter Olympics in Beijing.

title: Sheringham man declutters his life to just 406 items
description: Self-declared "extreme organiser" Nick has reduced his entire worldly possessions to just 406 items.

title: The Papers: 'Duke pays up' in deal to settle sex assault case
description: Wednesday's front pages focus on Prince Andrew and Virginia Giuffre reaching an out-of-court settlement.

title: Winter Olympics: USA's Alexander Hall 'defies physics' to win men's slopestyle gold
description: American Alexander Hall takes men's slopestyle gold with a score of 90.01, compatriot Nicholas Goepper claims silver and bronze went to Sweden's Jesper Tjader.

title: Ukrainians wary of Russian claims of withdrawal
description: Kyiv says it wants to see evidence that Russia really is moving troops away from the border.

title: Naftali Bennett: Warm welcome for Israeli leader in Bahrain
description: In scenes unthinkable a few years ago, Israel's Naftali Bennett looks to forge a "ring of alliance".

title: Two glasses of wine enough to hit daily sugar limit
description: Some wines contain more sugar than a doughnut, but carry no nutritional information on their labels.

title: Hungarian election: Orban faces toughest race so far
description: An independent conservative will try to topple the right-wing Fidesz government in polls on 3 April.

title: More than eight million trees lost this winter in the UK
description: How eight million trees have already been brought down this winter, with thousands more threatened by storms.

title: Single's Inferno: Why 'fake' rich girl Song Ji-a enraged South Korea
description: Song Ji-a shot to fame on Netflix show Single's Inferno, but then had a spectacular fall from grace.

title: Karnataka hijab controversy is polarising its classrooms

title: Huge relief as Man Utd boost Champions League hopes - but how much is at stake?
description: As Man Utd return to the top four, BBC Sport's Simon Stone looks at what is stake in their hunt for Champions League football.
